extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 3 scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 2 lbs extra large shrimp, peeled and de-veined

title: Vietnamese Caramelized Shrimp
summary: Vietnamese Caramelized Shrimp is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 30 servings. For 69 cents per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 6g of protein, 2g of fat, and a total of 53 calories. 70 people have made this recipe and would make it again. A couple people really liked this Vietnamese dish. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. A mixture of water, shrimp, scallions, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is rather bad. Try Vietnamese Noodle Salad With Caramelized Pork, Vietnamese Caramelized Pork and Rice Noodle Salad, and Vietnamese Shrimp Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Rabble Pinot Gris. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Combine the fish sauce, dark brown sugar, crushed red pepper flakes and water in a medium bowl and whisk until brown sugar is dissolved.Heat the vegetable oil in a large saut pan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook a few minutes more. Do not brown.Turn the heat up to medium-high and add the shrimp. Cook, stirring frequently, until the shrimp are just barely pink and still translucent in spots, a few minutes. Add the fish sauce mixture, turn heat down to medium, and simmer until shrimp are cooked through, a few minutes more. (Note: the sauce will be thin.) Off the heat, stir in scallions and cilantro. Serve immediately with jasmine rice.

steps.step: Combine the fish sauce, dark brown sugar, crushed red pepper flakes and water in a medium bowl and whisk until brown sugar is dissolved.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large saut pan over medium heat.
Add the onions and cook, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.

Add the garlic and cook a few minutes more. Do not brown.Turn the heat up to medium-high and add the shrimp. Cook, stirring frequently, until the shrimp are just barely pink and still translucent in spots, a few minutes.
Add the fish sauce mixture, turn heat down to medium, and simmer until shrimp are cooked through, a few minutes more. (Note: the sauce will be thin.) Off the heat, stir in scallions and cilantro.
